  • AHAdult Humor

  • GVGraphic Violence

...All the Marbles (R) 1:53 Adult language, mild violence, brief nudity. Two beautiful lady wrestlers and their wisecracking manager search for fame and fortune in a fast-action comedy. Peter Falk stars as the trainer aiming for the big time. Vicki Frederick and Laurene Landon are his “California Dolls.” With Burt Young as a sleazy promoter. 1982:
Sep 2,​3,​5,​9,​11,​12,​18,​20,​21,​23,​28,​29		 12
...And Justice For All (R) 2:00 Profanity, adult situations, nudity. Al Pacino
There are a few lawyers who still believe in guilt and innocence. Al Pacino is brilliant in his Oscar-nominated performance as an attorney who fights the system, Comedy alternates with high drama in this look at the complexities and corruption of American justice. Christine Lahti co-stars. as a lusty lady lawyer who shares Pacino's bed, but not his convictions.		 1980:
Nov 23,​27

10 (1979) (R) 1:58 AL, N Julie Andrews Dudley Moore Bo Derek
You saw her in the magazines. You loved her on the poster. Now see sensual, sensational Bo Derek in the hottest, most talked-about movie of the year, the film that makes her the sex symbol of the ‘80s. Dudley Moore is hilarious as the hit songwriter who’s captivated by Bo’s perfect 10 beauty. Julie Andrews co-stars. Classical Hollywood comedy (Newsweek)		 1980:

Crocodile Dundee II (1988) (PG) 1:50 AL, V PAUL HOGAN
LINDA KAZLOWSKI
Is Mick Dundee any match for Colombian drug thugs? You bet your boomerang he is, mate, as everybody's favorite Aussie returns in this blockbuster comedy sequel. Growing restless in the Big Apple with his girlfriend (Linda Kozlowski), Crocodile Dundee yearns for home — but it takes his lady's kidnapping by a cocaine kingpin to get him there. From misfit city stickler to wily Outback tracker, Mick's your man for rock 'em, sock 'em laughs and action.
THE BEST MOVIES ARE ON HBO		 1989:

Oct 1		 13
1st & Ten HBO COMEDY Her ex-husband got his freedom... but she got the team! Some divorcées take the house. Some take the car. Dianne took her husband's Bulls. A sexy socialite wins her husband's football team in a divorce settlement and pro sports will never be the same! For adults.

The pilot, which aired in December of 1984, was listed in the guide as "First and Ten", but when the series premiered in August of 1985, it was then referred to as "1st & Ten."-JS		 1984:

First and Ten (pilot) - aka 1st & Ten Adult language, nudity. HBO COMEDY Her ex-husband got his freedom... but she got the team! Some divorcées take the house. Some take the car. Dianne took her husband's Bulls. A sexy socialite wins her husband's football team in a divorce settlement and pro sports will never be the same! For adults. 1984:
Dec 2,​5,​9,​11,​14,​18,​24,​27		 8
1st & Ten "The Opener" :30 Adult situations, nudity. Can the fun-loving Bulls score all the way to the Super Bowl? Follow the football season with HBO's exclusive new limited comedy series, where the laughs are big-league and there's as much scoring off the field as on. The new owner of the California Bulls isa lady with a locker room full of comic woes. Can her team possibly win the opener? 1985:

1941 (1979) (PG) 1:59 Adult language, humor. Dan Aykroyd
John Belushi
They roared into battle, but one thing was missing: the enemy. A comedy based on the real panic that seized California after Pearl Harbor, this misadventure features John Belushi as a maniacal pilot and Dan Aykroyd as a mechanic turned tank commander. A wacky nonstop stream of action, sight gags and special effects. Three Oscar nominations.		 1981:
Nov 22,​26
Dec 4,​7,​12,​17
1982:
Apr 11,​12,​15,​16,​24,​26,​29		 16
1979 in Sports HBO recaptures the headline-making moments of the year in this cavalcade of champions — ane near-champions. It's Willie Stargell leading his Pirates to a World Series victory straight up from near defeat. It's John McEnroe and Tracy Austin bringing tennis laurels back to the U.S.A., and Earvin Johnson trying his brand of magic on behalf of the Lakers. The Steelers roll on, Larry Holmes keeps his crown, Kurt Thomas gets ready for another Olympic gold and the Canadiens ice another Stanley Cup. 1980:
Jan 8,​12,​14,​17,​20		 5
1980 American Bodybuilding Championships It's the Mr, America contest, telecast for the first time. And to prove that men don't have a corner on muscles, women bodybuilders will perform in their own completion.

Nov 1,​5,​10		 4
1980 World Series Scouting Report SPORTS SPECIAL
HBO Sports' up-to-the-minute scouting reports puts you inside the game by examining both club's strengths and weaknesses, their starting pitchers, their bullpens, benches, offenses and defenses. Nothing adds more enjoyment to baseball than knowing who is apt to do what. Who's the toughest out in the clutch on the two World Series teams? What's the best way to pitch to the heavy hitters? Tune in for an expert look at this year's October classic. Hosted by Len Berman. 		1980:
Oct 13,​14		 3
1981 American Bodybuilding Championships SPORTS SPECIAL
The top-level muscle men compete for the Mr. America title, which the women vie for their own honors and pair off with the men for a mixed contest. There is a special look at the muscle women in Beauty vs. Brawn and a profile of Lou Ferrigno (The Incredible Hulk and former Mr. America), also the guest commentator.		 1981:
Dec 22,​26,​30
1982:
Jan 3		 6
2001: A Space Odyssey (G) 2:19 Join two astronauts and HAL, their computer companion, on a voyage to the moon, distant planets and the farthest stars. A hypnotic journey to infinity, only 20 years away, this epic drama of exploration is an all-time sci-fi classic. Directed by Stanley Kubrick. Keir Dullea and Gary Lockwood co-star. An Oscar winner for Special Visual Effects. Sheer beauty (N.Y. Post) 1981:
Jan 2,​5,​10,​11,​13,​21,​25		 7
2010: The Year We Make Contact (PG) 1:56 AL, MV Roy Scheider John Lithgow
Dazzling special effects highlight this continuation of 2001:A Space Odyssey, as the spaceship “Discovery” falls into a dangerous orbit near Jupiter. Can a joint U.S. and Soviet probe save the spacecraft and its on-board computer, HAL 9000? The adversary scientists work together while the superpowers on Earth edge closer to nuclear war. Roy Scheider heads the American crew. 		1986:
Jan 1,​2,​13,​18,​24,​26,​28
1987:
Mar 4,​17,​22,​26,​30		 16
48 Hrs. (1982) (R) 1:37 Adult language and humor, graphic violence, nudity. Nick Nolte Eddie Murphy - “Saturday Night Live’s” irrepressible Eddie Murphy, in his film debut, teams with tough guy Nick Nolte in one of the most explosive—and uproarious—screen partnerships in years. The blockbuster crime adventure has smoo-o-o-th Eddie as a fast-talking, streetwise con sprung from the pen for two days to help hard-boiled cop Nolte hunt down a pair of vicious killers. 1984:

Shirley MacLaine

All Ralphie Parker wants for Christmas isa genuine Red Ryder air rifle. But Ralphie's quirky father is too busy to listen to his son. Darren McGavin stars as Mr. Parker and Peter Billingsley ("Real People") plays Ralphie in this warm, insightful comedy drama about growing up.		 1985:

A Cry in the Dark (PG-13) 2:01 AL She is the most hated woman in Australia. The public believes she murdered her baby, but Lindy Chamberlain insists that a dingo, a wild dog, took her son. A Dangerous Life 6:00 AS MARCOS TAUGHT THEM FEAR.
AQUINO TAUGHT THEM COURAGE.
A SIX-HOUR MINI-SERIES EVENT
SOME THINGS ARE WORTH DYING FOR.
This epic mini-series takes you into the center of a pivotal world event—the 1986 Four-Day Revolution in the Philippines— and into the lives of the men and women who helped create it. Gary Busey stars in a drama that combines actual news-reel footage with the fictionalized story of an American newsman stationed in Manila at the time of Benigno Aquino's assassination, the fall of Ferdinand Marcos and the rise to power of the indomitable Corazon Aquino. Bristling with political controversy, high adventureand deep-felt human emotion. 		1988:
Nov 27,​28,​29
1989:
Jul 1,​8,​15		 6

A Fish Called Wanda (R) 1:48 AL, V, N JOHN CLEESE WANDA JAMIE LEE CURTIS KEVIN KLINE MICHAEL PALIN
You'll fall hook, line and sinker for this zany, sexy, witty romp with a superb cast (Newsday). Jamie Lee Curtis is Wanda, a buxom American beauty who gets involved in a London jewel heist. Kevin Kline won a 1988 Best Supporting actor Oscar® for his off-the-wall performance as Wanda's jealous, psychotic safecracker lover. John Cleese plays an uptight lawyer in this hilarious crime caper that's sure to be the catch of the month.		 1989:
Jul 8,​13,​19,​25,​28,​29,​31		 7
A Force of One (PG) 1:31 Violence, profanity, adult situations. Chuck Norris
Jennifer O'Neil
This unusual suspense thriller pits a martial arts champion against a vicious karate killer. Check Norris, six-time world titleholder, comes to the aid of a California narcotics squad when ace agents are methodically murdered. Co-star Jennifer O’Neill is an undercover cop.		 1980:

Steve Allen is the anchorman of this un-conventional look at Campaign '80 A hilarious group of commentators take satirical aim at candidates and campaigns. You're invited to a political party packed with sketches, songs and interviews that you won't see on the nightly news.		 1980:

A Man, A Woman and A Bank (PG) 1:41 Profanity, adult situations. Donald Sutherland
A sophisticated comedy caper about a $4 million computerized bank heist. Donald Sutherland and director Paul Mazursky (An Unmarried Woman) are two crooks with an ingenious scheme aimed at an impenetrable bank. Brooke Adams (Days of Heaven) provides romantic distraction s a commercial photographer with a mind of her own.		 1980:

Ace Award Winner (1988) 2:00 Presentation of feature filim or special(s) cited for 1987 ACE Award for excellence in cable programming.

The ACE awards (Award for Cable Excellence) ran from 1978 to 1997 to recogize television shows on cable that were ignored by the Emmys. Once the Emmys started acknowledging cable, they ended. Not sure what was actually shown on this night. -JS		 1988:
Jan 27		 1

LIVE January 24

America Undercover: GETTING EVEN Victims Fight Back Robbery. Assault. Rape. Murder. Violent crime strikes every 24 seconds in the U.S. Many victims are angry, scared, legally frustrated—victims for life. Others are fighting back. This film focuses on four true stories. In one, a mother works for legislative change after her daughter's rape and murder; in another, a psychologist who was mugged twice forms a victims’ counseling center. 1984:
Jul 18,​19,​24,​25,​29,​31
Aug 2,​11		 8
America Undercover: Into Madness :57 More Americans are hospitalized with schizophrenia than with any other mental illness. It strikes suddenly and without warning. This documentary, produced by the Emmy-winning team of Alan and Susan Raymond, examines the lives of three families coping with the tragedy of schizophrenia. It's a moving, eye-opening examination of a disease science knows too little about. 1989:
Jul 6,​11,​21,​23,​29,​30,​31
Sep 11		 9
America Undercover: Kids in Crisis 1:00 This year, 50,000 teenagers will be hospitalized for anti-social behavior and psychiatric disorders. America Undercover visits treatment centers to understand how troubled kids are attempting to overcome these problems. Approx. 1:00 1986:

Apr 27		 1
America Undercover: Life or Death in the Emergency Room The emergency room. It’s the war zone of illness and injury. Highly skilled doctors and nurses are engaged in a constant battle to save lives.This is a graphic, real-life look inside one of the nation's best for a close-up of a medical unit in action. Split-second decisions determine life or death as the dedicated team treats a critically wounded stabbing victim, a boy hit by a car and a woman injured in an auto accident who is close to death. 1984:
Jun 20,​24,​28
Jul 4,​8,​10,​11		 7
America Undercover: Missing Persons — Four True Stories (1985) From the original HBO documentary that examined four true stories of missing persons, this updated version reveals what has happened in each of these cases. 1985:
Aug 8,​9,​12,​16,​21,​22,​23,​27,​28		 9
America Undercover: Missing Persons: Four True Stories (1984) Every year thousands of adults vanish without a trace. One moment they're living normal lives, and the next moment they're gone. Why are these people missing, and how did they disappear? This documentary includes four true stories, revealing the devastating effects on families left behind. One bizarre situation involves a cry of foul play when a man remarries after his wife has vanished. 1984:
Aug 19,​22,​25,​28,​29,​30
Sep 3,​4,​7		 12
America Undercover: Murder or Mercy: Five American Families :53 Should you help a terminaly ill loved one die, or do you preserve life at all costs? This is a thought-provoking, poignant look at five families who have faced that painful question. They tell what it means to live with the consequences of their decisions. 1988:

America Undercover: Rapists—Can They Be Stopped? 1:00 HBO SPECIAL
Rape has become epidemic: a rape occurs every eight minutes somewhere in the United States. This hard-hitting documentary examines men who commit this violently damaging crime. A powerful film that is not recommended for people who may be sensitive to its strong content.		 1986:

America Undercover: Sexual Abuse of Children — Beyond the Secret Adult subject matter, language. HBO SPECIAL - This gripping documentary goes beyond the shocking statistics to explore one of our nation's most disturbing social problems. Four real stories of child sexual abuse are revealed by the people who have experienced it—victimized children, their families and molesters. Among the victims: two teenage sisters. 1985:

Angry, often dangerous men, these Vietnam vets are hidden from American society. In this gripping documentary, cameras penetrate remote areas for the first time to record the lifestyles of six haunted veterans. 1984:

America Undercover: The Gift of Life Every 73 seconds a child with a physical or mental handicap is born in America. Many of these children are saved, but not cured. This poignant documentary visits the children's ward of a major hospital and observes how two courageous families have learned to cope with chronically ill children. 1986:
Jan 12,​16,​20,​28		 5
America Undercover: The Nightmare of Cocaine It's a $50-billion-a-year business and an estimated 25 million Americans have tried it at least once. What is cocaine? A drug for the rich and famous? A non-addictive high? This hard-hitting documentary shatters myths about “the drug of the '80s.” True stories include the experiences of a basketball super star, an auto factory worker and a psychiatrist. 1984:

America Undercover: The Search for Mengele Who was Dr, Josef Mengele? How could one man be responsible for so many deaths in Nazi war camps—and escape capture for so many years? This is the story of Mengele, the man and the fugitive, and the truth about his mysterious life. With eyewitness accounts from family members, Auschwitz survivors, and others. 1985:
Oct 14,​15,​17,​18,​20,​23,​26,​29		 9

A peaceful elementary school with an alarmingly high number of children getting sick! What is the cause and what can be done to stop it? This documentary shows three brave citizens leading the battle against pollution in their communities. 1984:

Boxing's Best Jack Dempsey SPORTS SERIES
He symbolized the '20s: a one time barroom punch-out artist who became a champion. See the Manassa Mauler fight Angel Firpo, get knocked out of the ring and come roaring back. Plus boxing’s famous long count in Dempsey’s second historic title bout with Gene Tunney.		 1981:

Boxing's Best: Grudge Fights Ali vs. Frazier. Louis vs. Schmeling. Zale vs. Graziano. More than great bouts, they were fierce grudge fights. These and other classic match-ups—a half century of box- ing’s most historic vendettas—come alive through vintage footage. 1982:
Apr 15,​19,​21,​27		 4
Boxing's Best: Jack Johnson SPORTS SERIES
His style was flamboyant, his nickname was the “Galveston Giant,” and he was the first black ever to become the world heavyweight champ. Jack Johnson reigned from 1908 to 1915, in the days when a fight could go 45 rounds. Take a ringside look at his long career, including vintage footage of famed bouts with Jess Willard and James J. Jeffries plus a rare glimpse at his extraordinary private life.		 1982:
Mar 25,​29,​30,​31		 6
Boxing's Best: Joe Louis He had class and style and perhaps the greatest knockout punch ever. Here’s your chance to see vintage film clips of Joe Louis in his prime. Catch him in such memorable bouts as the ferocious Max Schmeling rematch and his 1941 title defense against the great Billy Conn, the show’s guest host. 1981:
Feb 12,​14,​16		 4
Boxing's Best: Muhammad Ali SPORTS SERIES
Among those who feel Ali was the greatest heavyweight ever is Ali himself. See the bouts that made boxing history—with Frazier and others. Watch how Ali stung like a bee, stood up for his beliefs and became, perhaps, the best ever.		 1981:
May 28,​30,​31

Championship Boxing: Marvin Hagler vs. Vito Antuofermo For the second time this year on HBO, Marvin Hagler puts his universal middleweight crown on the line. Tonight he meets arch rival and former title holder Vito Antuofermo in a scheduled 15-rounder, live from the Boston Garden. It's a matchup between two sluggers who hit hard and often. They last touched gloves late in 1979 when Antuofermo (46-5-2, 19 KOs) retained his championship against Hagler (51-2-2, 42 KOs). After their bout, each thought he had won and each wanted a rematch. This time it should be a battle.Barry Tompkins and Larry Merchant offer expert commentary. 1981:

Comic Relief™- Best Of (1986) 1:30 HBO Brings You the Best of...
COMIC RELIEF™
Hosted by Billy Crystal Whoopi Goldberg Robin Williams
A Comedy Event to Help America's Poor and Homeless
On March 29, America's comedy community joined hands in a star-studded event to help the homeless. Now see all the highlights of that once-in-a-lifetime show, as the three hosts welcome your favorite comedy stars.		 1986:
Apr 6,​7,​9,​15,​25		 5
Common Threads: Stories from the Quilt 1:10 Take a touching and personal look at the history of the AIDS epidemic in this story of passion, tragedy and commitment. This program looks at five of the stories memorialized in the AIDS Quilt that is now touring the country. Young and old, men and woman, Common Threads shows the cross-section of Americans that has become infected with AIDS, and illustrates the love and courage they and their friends and families demonstrate in coping with the effects of this devastating illness. 1989:

Countdown to 'Looking Glass' An HBO Original Drama Scott Glenn Michael Murphy Helen Shaver Patrick Watson With Eric Sevareid and Nancy Dickerson as themselves - It may be later than you think. This chillingly realistic drama portrays what could be a true scenario for the outbreak of World War III. Presented from the point of view of a television news team, the shocking events are not science fiction but science fact, based on an authentic military study of how a nuclear war could start. Scott Glenn, Michael Murphy, Helen Shaver Patric Watson star as the TV reporters in this compelling, timely drama about the imminent danger of war. 1984:

Coupling: Sexual Lifestyles in the '80s. SWINGING
SWAPPING
COMPUTER MATING
SEX CLUBS
MARRIAGE
What are people trying today in order to make relationships work? Sexual swinging. Commercial sex clubs. Open marriage. Traditional Marriage. Computer-dating. These are among the things people do to stay together, to not be alone, to find fulfillment. A fascinating look at our changing values and morality. No judgements are made.		 1980:

David Letterman: Looking for Fun SPECIAL
A lighthearted comedy spoof of the ways that people amuse themselves. And all seen through the eyes of that uniquely imaginative funnyman, David Letterman (Johnny Carson’s frequent guest host). Hilarious highlights include: rafting on the Los Angeles “River”; a tour of the movie stars’ homes in Beverly Hills; Fun Center in Hollywood; and “fun” places to eat. An HBO and Children's Television Workshop presentation.
A Distinguished Productions, Inc. series.
Volumes of Entertainment from A to Z!
The letters H through K are highlighted in this month's segment of the exclusive series that entertains while it teaches. Flashback: Fire at the Cocoanut Grove SERIES
Hosted by Eric Sevareid
It was a festive night in 1942 when a small flame turned Boston’s Cocoanut Grove nightclub into an inferno—and 400 people died. This unique docudrama combines historical footage with dramatic reenactment in an account of one of the worst tragedies in nightclub history. Who was to blame? Could it happen again?		 1982:

HUNDREDS FEARED DEAD
MYSTERIOUS DEATHS OF PLEASURE SHIP
Hosted by Eric Sevareid
On Sept. 8, 1934, in the midst of the Depression, the pleasure ship Morro Castle embarked on a doomed voyage. Murder, arson—both are suspected in the unexplained inferno that took 137 lives. Learn the facts and piece together the mystery of the tragic journey.		 1982:

Flashback: Wall Street Crash 1929 Four Survivors On October 29, 1929, the stock market crashed, setting off the Great Depression. Nobody knows exactly how it happened. This unusual show combines newsreels with dramatized stories of four “survivors”—a flapper, shoeshine boy, salesman and heiress. A fascinating account of the disasters effect on people's lives. 1982:

Gandhi (PG) 3:14 Violence. Academy Award Winner Best Picture Ben Kingsley Candice Bergen - A stirring, spectacular epic and winner of eight Academy Awards, including Best Picture! Ben Kingsley (Betrayal) gives an astonishing performance as one of the world's great men of peace. Director Richard Attenborough recreates Mahatma Gandhi's odyssey over five tumultuous decades. Gandhi's principles of nonviolence and passive resistance direct him to the spiritual leadership of a modern India looking to overthrow British rule. Cast includes Martin Sheen, John Gielgud and Trevor Howard. 1984:

Glory! Glory! Part 1 1:30 SEX DRUGS ROCK & ROLL AND RELIGION
ELLEN GREENE
RICHARD THOMAS
JAMES WHITMORE
WINSTON REKERT
The greatest story ever sold.
An HBO two-part movie.
Ruth is a tough, sexy, hard-living rock 'n' roll singer with a seedy past and a brilliant future—if she can get the exposure she needs. Bobby Joe is the TV minister who falls in love with her and offers her an unexpected chance to make falls for Ruth—and is the only man who can expose the secret that will destroy all her hopes success. Ellen Greene (Little Shop of Horrors) plays Ruth in this provocative movie event. Richard Thomas plays Bobby Joe: Winston Rekert (Adderly) is Chet.		 1989:
Feb 19,​24
Jun 28		 3

Gorillas in the Mist (PG-13) 2:09 AS, AL, V The Adventure of Dian Fossey
SIGOURNEY WEAVER
Here it is—the five-time Oscar®-nominated 1988 film of the woman who gave her life for the gorillas she loved. Sigourney Weaver (nominated for Best Actress) stars in this true story as Dian Fossey, the passionate and self-assured adventurer who fights to save the African mountain gorillas from extinction at the hands of poachers. With Bryan Brown (F/X).

Greatest Sports Rivalries Lakers vs. Celtics Sports fans remember the ‘60s. Six times the Boston Celtics faced the L.A. Lakers for the NBA championship. It seemed the outcome always rested on a Bill Russell rebound, a miraculous pass from Bob Cousy or a basket by Jerry West. HBO Sports revisits this intense rivalry with rare footage plus interviews with past stars as they describe those pressure-cooker games. There’ll also be a special look at Russell’s legendary defensive wizardry. 1980:
Apr 23,​26,​27,​29
May 1		 5
Greatest Sports Rivalries New York Giants vs. Cleveland Browns For years, Browns-Giants games were wars. HBO brings them back with vintage footage and exclusive interviews. Watch Jimmy Brown’s power runs. Otto Graham’s passes. Paul Warfield’s catches. And then see Rosie Grier and Sam Huff, of the Giants, try to stop them—so Grank Gifford, Kyle Rote and Charlie Conerly can move the ball. To point out the caliber of talent: more than 30 stars went on to coach in the pros. 1980:
Dec 30
1981:
Jan 2,​5		 3
Greatest Sports Rivalries USC vs. Notre Dame Since the Irish beat the Trojans 13-12 in 1926, there hasn't been a breather in this series. What a line-up through the years—like O.J. Simpson, Nick Buoniconti, Pat Hayden, Joe Theismann and Rocky Blier! Hosts Barry Tompkins and Paul Hornung bring you interviews and all the spectacular catches, runs and heart-failre finales of one of the best rivalries ever. 1980:
Nov 26
Dec 2,​4		 3
Greatest Sports Rivalries Yankees vs. Dodgers Every time they met it was fireworks — and they met in 10 World Series. Remember Cookie Lavagetto's pinch hit in '47? Johnny Podres' shutout in '55? Sandy Koufax's pitching in '63? Great moments for Dodger fans. But Yankee rooters prefer Billy Martin's game-saving catch in '52, Don Larsen's perfect game in '56 and Reggie Jackson's homers in '77. See it all plus recent interviews with stars of this memorable rivalry. 1980:
May 22,​26

HBO Comedy Hour: I, Martin Short, Goes Hollywood 1:00 We're talkin' serious comedy here.
Martin Short's Comedy Hour debut is long on laughs as he reveals his lifetime love affair with the glory and glamour of Tinseltown. Eight of his most bizarre characters—including nerdy Ed Grimley and slimy songster Jackie Rogers, Jr—help tell the story of Martin, a star-struck 450 lb. teenager who grew up to be a big star. HBO Comedy Hour: The Montreal International Comedy Festival 1989 1:00 JULIE BROWN ROBERT KLEIN JERRY SEINFELD RICH HALL BOBCAT GOLDTHWAIT ROWAN ATKINSON RICK DUCOMMUN and more!
PREMIERE SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 4 [1989]
Take the funniest men and women in the world, put them together, and you have the Cannes Festival of Comedy. It's nonstop laughs when some of comedy's best talent join forces with some of the funniest people from around the world. HBO comedy favorites are joined by Spain's El Tricicle, England's Rowan Atkinson and South Africa's Pieter-Dirk Uys for an hour of pure entertainment!

HBO Comedy Playhouse: Bedrooms Renee Taylor Joseph Bologna Louise Lasser Charles Grodin Jane Curtin - Celebrate life's lighter side in this new series of comedy productions—all written and produced especially for HBO by some of America's outstanding comedy talents. In HBO's first Comedy Playhouse the curtain goes up on four funny stories about love, sex and marriage behind the closed doors of America’s bedrooms. The witty vignettes include a married couple on an encounter weekend, another couple hesitantly embarking on parenthood and a fantasy-fulfilling ménage a trois. 1984:

HBO Comedy Playhouse: Welcome to Greater Tuna Texas (Population 2) A distinctly different comedy for adults, based on the off-Broadway smash. When a Texas judge is found dead in bed by his housekeeper (wearing her bikini), the circumstances are a bit unusual. HBO Pictures™: Murderers Among Us—The Simon Wiesenthal Story 3:00 AS, V, N BEN KINGSLEY
He was their victim.
Now he is their hunter.
PREMIERES APRIL 23
Once he was the Nazis' victim; now he is their tireless pursuer. This is the true story of Simon Wiesenthal, whose relentless search for German war criminals has indelibly burned the horrors of the Holocaust into the World's consciousness. Made with Wiesenthal's full cooperation, this searing, inspiring drama follows his life from concentration camp through reunion with a loving family to an obsession with bringing Nazis to justice. Ben Kingsley, winner of the 1982 Best Actor Oscar® for Gandhi, plays the famous Nazi hunter. with Renee Soutendijk as his wife and Craig T. Nelson as Major Harcourt.		 1989:
Apr 23,​27,​29
May 3,​9,​12,​18
Jul 9		 10
HBO Pictures™: Third Degree Burn (aka 3rd Degree Burn) 1:37 AS, AL, V, N TREAT WILLIAMS
VIRGINIA MADSEN
HBO Pictures™
Passion in the first degree. Murder in the second.
The price for getting too close.
When a love affair gets this hot, it could lead to murder. Just as hard-luck private eye Scott Weston (Treat Williams) thinks he's found the right woman at last, he's accused of killing her wealthy, older husband. Williams and Virginia Madsen (Long Gone), the bored, beautiful woman he's hired to follow, become dangerous lovers in this provocative adult thriller.		 1989:
May 28
Jun 1,​4,​7,​9,​12		 7
HBO Pictures™: Traveling Man (1989) 1:45 AS, AL HAVE GUTS, WILL TRAVEL.
JOHN LITHGOW
JONATHAN SILVERMAN
Ben Cluett is a salesman whose life is an endless round of motels, fastfood joints and two-lane highways. His new young partner, Billy, is determined to claw his way to the top. John Lithgow stars in this warmhearted comedy-drama as Ben, who's beginning to wonder if this is the life he really wants. Jonathan Silverman plays Billy, who learns a valuable lesson in frendship from Ben.
Hard work and hype made him a success.
A smart kid and a good woman are about to make him happy.		 1989:

HBO Premiere Films™ The Park is Mine 1:46 AS, AL, V, BN In the next 72 hours, Mitch Harris is going to make them listen.
TOMMY LEE JONES
In a one-man maneuver, an emotionally shattered Vietnam veteran takes NewYork's Central Park hostage. Tommy Lee Jones stars in this taut thriller as a loner who believes his dramatic act will bring attention to the plight of men who fought for their country. As the city sends its best forces in to fight against him, Jones finds himself at a point of no return, relying on his expert knowledge of jungle warfare to survive. Helen Shaver plays a persistent TV reporter who lands in the middle of danger.		 1985:

HBO Premiere Films:™ Act of Vengeance 1:34 AS, AL, V, SC, Charles Bronson is Jock Yablonski. Thousands of miners wanted him as their leader. The union boss wanted him dead.
The true story of an American hero.
Charles Bronson Ellen Burstyn
A bitter rivalry led to a violent, shattering crime. In 1969, Joseph "Jock" Yablonski challenged corrupt union chief Tony Boyle for leadership of the United Mine Workers. What followed in an isolated farmhouse jolted one of America's most powerful unions into the national spotlight. This HBO Premiere Films drama traces the chilling chain of events that ended in a horrible, unforgettable tragedy.		 1986:
Apr 20,​24,​29
May 3,​8,​12

HBO Premiere Films:™ All the Rivers Run Part 1 1:40 Adult situations and language, mild violence. A four part mini-series from HBO Premiere Films. A turbulent saga of turn-of-the-century Australia. Sigrid Thornton John Waters - HBO's first mini-series, a powerful adventure filmed in rugged down under locations, tells of Philadelphia Gordon, a spirited woman determined to forge a place for herself in a man’s world. The hazards she faces on untamed rivers, an affair with an elegant man of the world, her tempestuous marriage to a rakish riverboat captain—all contribute to the series’ epic sweep. Sigrid Thornton (The Man From Snowy River) stars as the rebellious heroine; John Waters (Breaker Morant) is the dashing man she loves. The full saga will be shown in four parts on four successive evenings and then completely repeated as noted at right. 1984:
Jan 15,​23,​27

HBO Premiere Films:™ Blackout 1:40 Adult situations and language, violence. Seven years ago someone murdered the Vinson family. No one knows who. Not even the killer.
TERROR WEARS A FACE ALL ITS OWN
Richard Widmark Keith Carradine Kathleen Quinlan Michael Beck
A nightmare of menace, suspicion and fear—a suspense thriller with a shattering conclusion! Richard Widmark (Against All Odds) stars as an embittered retired detective tormented by a gruesome murder he is unable to solve. Keith Carradine is an accident victim who could hold the key to the mystery. Kathleen Quinlan (Twilight Zone — The Movie) plays a nurse who marries Carradine, unaware of what his past might hold. Michael Beck (‘Celebrity’) plays Quinlan’s former lover. 		1985:

HBO Premiere Films:™ Forbidden Adult situations, mild violence. Jacqueline Bisset — IN WARTIME GERMANY SHE HAD TO RISK EVERYTHING TO LOVE HIM. A true story. — Lovers trapped in the terrifying world of war-torn Berlin risk their lives for a relationship forbidden by the Nazis. Jacqueline Bisset plays an aristocratic countess whose passionate affair leads her into WWII’s dangerous underground. International star Jurgen Prochnow (The Boat) is her lover, a writer from an upper-class Jewish family who’s torn between loyalty to his country and a yearning for freedom. Raw courage, cunning, and strong will are the sole weapons for a teacher and her pupils when four masked strangers invade their isolated schoolhouse. What do the men want? Where did they come from? HBO Premiere Films:™ Gulag 2:09 Adult language, violence, nudity. For an American in the Russian Gulag the only challenge is survival. The only hope is an impossible escape. David Keith Malcom McDowell Caught in the nightmare of a Soviet labor camp, an American newsman has only one chance for freedom. David Keith stars in HBO Premiere Films’ tense drama as a former Olympian covering an international sports event in Moscow. Trapped in a web of intrigue spun by the KGB and sentenced to a brutal gulag, he is unable to adjust to its killing work schedule and inhuman living conditions. With the help of a fellow prisoner (Malcolm McDowell), he launches a desperate plan for escape. 1985:

HBO Premiere Films:™ Murrow 1:54 AL DABNEY COLEMAN
ROBERT VAUGHN
EDWARD HERRMANN
JOHN McMARTIN
When the news was radio, he gave ita voice. When the news became television, he gave ita conscience.
The man who made the news.
DANIEL J.TRAVANTI
On the air, Edward R. Murrow was a fearless voice for millions, a man who challenged both the entire U.S. Air Force as well as a power-hungry politician. Off the air, he fought his own bosses for integrity in broadcasting. Daniel J.Travanti (Emmy winner for “Hill Street Blues") stars as the legendary newsman in HBO Premiere Films’ moving, human drama set against two decades of tension and crisis. Dabney Coleman plays CBS founder William Paley; Edward Herrmann is producer Fred Friendly; John McMartin appears as Frank Stanton. With Robert Vaughn as F.D.R. 		1986:
Jan 19,​24,​27,​30
Feb 4,​8

HBO Premiere Films:™ Mussolini: The Decline and Fall of Il Duce - Part 1 1:45 Violence. Susan Sarandon Anthony Hopkins Bob Hoskins
While Dictator Benito Mussolini ruled Italy with an iron fist, he was unable to control his own daughter. In this compelling drama of a personal war between Il Duce and his family, Susan Sarandon plays his willful daughter, Edda—torn between devotion to her father (Bob Hoskins) and love for her husband, Count Ciano (Anthony Hopkins). This griping but little known story that affected the fate of a nation was filmed on location in Italy where these World War Il events took place. In two parts.
AS HIS NATION FIGHTS FOR SURVIVAL IL DUCE FIGHTS FOR HIS LIFE.
THE EPIC STORY THAT'S NEVER BEEN TOLD. 		1985:
Sep 8,​18,​24,​28

HBO Premiere Films:™ Reunion at Fairborough 1:50 Adult situations. He won the war but lost the girl. Forty years later he wants her back. —Deborah Kerr Robert Mitchum — Can a WWII romance, ended four decades ago, be revived in the 1980s? Robert Mitchum, a disillusioned American hero, tries to find out when he returns to England for an Air Corps reunion and searches for his love of long ago—Deborah Ker. When she reveals a secret kept from him during the war, her revelation ignites a conflict between generations that is at the heart of this bittersweet drama. With Red Buttons. 1985:

HBO Premiere Films:™ Sakharov 1:59 Jason Robards Glenda Jackson - To the Soviet Union, he is an enemy. To the free world, he is a hero. In HBO Premiere Films’ powerful and timely drama right out of today’s headlines, Jason Robards stars as Andrei Sakharov, the man who cannot be silenced. This distinguished Russian physicist, Nobel Prize winner and dissident dared to speak out for human rights in a repressive society. Glenda Jackson plays Elena Bonner, his wife and steadfast partner in exile. Cast includes Anna Massey and Nicol Williamson. 1984:

Jodie Foster Michael Ontkean - Caught in the turmoil of WWII, a pair of star-crossed lovers face overwhelming odds to keep their romance from shattering. HBO Premiere Films:™ The Far Pavilions Part 1 1:50 Adult situations, mild violence. Ben Cross Amy Irving John Gielgud Omar Sharif - A three-part mini-series from HBO Premiere Films™. An exotic love story set against the epic sweep of battle and the splendor of 19th-century colonial India. In HBO Premiere Films’ most lavish miniseries to date, Ben Cross (Chariots of Fire) stars as a British officer, born in India, who is torn between his military duties and his love for an Indian princess. Amy Irving (Yentl) plays the woman he loves in the forbidden affair. Based on M.M. Kaye's bestseller, the strikingly photographed blend of action, romance and history was filmed on location in India. The large all-star cast includes John Gielgud, Omar Sharif, Rossano Brazzi and Christopher Lee. The full drama will unfold on three successive evenings and will be repeated completely as noted below. 1984:
Apr 22,​30

HBO Sellathon On December 6 and 7, [1980] there will be more than just great movies on HBO. Stay tuned between shows for our special HBO Sellathon. 0
HBO Showcase '86 Half a Lifetime 1:00 AL Gary Busey Keith Carradine Nick Mancuso Saul Rubinek
PREMIERE OF A COLLECTION OF ORIGINAL DRAMAS!
A friendly poker game turns ino a series encounter in which four men in their thirties challenge each other's hopes and dreams. Keith Carradine (Choose Me), Gary Busey (the Buddy Holly Story), Nick Mancuso (Nightwing) and Saul Rubinek (Sweet Liberty) star in this moving drama by Stephen Metcalfe. It is the first in HBO's innovative new series of drama specials dealing with human, contemporary themes.		 1986:
Jul 20,​21,​23,​29
1988:
Apr 19		 5

HBO Showcase: Time Flies When You're Alive 1:30 A true story celebrating life and love in the face of tragedy.
In 1986, actor Paul Linke and his wife learned she was dying of cancer. This is his account of their marriage, their family and the strengthening of their love in the face of her impending death. An exhilarating tour de force; funny, profound and unforgettable (L.A. Herald Examiner).		 1989:

HBO Sports Exclusive — World Championship Boxing LIVE! Jose Luis Ramirez vs. Hector "Macho" Camacho HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
World Championship Boxing
LIVE! August 10
Jose Luis Ramirez
vs.
Hector “Macho” Camacho
HBC Lightweight Title Fight
Courageous Jose Luis Ramirez came off the canvas to win the title from Edwin Rosario last November. But how will this veteran southpaw (92-4, 77 KOs) fare against a rising star—flashy Hector “Macho" Camacho? The hard-hitting challenger is undefeated in 27 bouts (16KOs). Tonight, it's brilliant talent matched against experience and heart. 		1985:

HBO Sports Presents: Wild West Roundup Rodeo just might be America’s most original sport. After all, Buffalo Bill Cody staged the first one 100 years ago. This HBO rodeo spectacular has it all;=: saddle bronc, bareback and bull riding, steer wrestling, calf roping and girls’ barrel racing on horseback. But there’s more! Singer Carlene Carter will also be there with some swinging country western music and dancing. It makes for a super blend and an all-round salute to the American West. 1980:

HBO Theater Presents Neil Simon's Plaza Suite Starring Lee Grant and Jerry Orbach
For a roomful of laughs, check into Plaza Suite, the long- running Broadway hit by the king of comedy writers, Neil Simon. The latest of HBO’s exclusive theater presentations is a trio of plays, all taking place inSuite 719 of New York’s Plaza Hotel. Lee Grant and Jerry Orbach each perform three very funny roles as couples who occupy the suite at three different times.

Hepburn and Tracy SPECIAL
Katharine Hepburn—energetic and otuspoken. Spencer Tracy—understated and old-fashioned. Together they became one of Hollywood's most popular and enduring teams. Heroes: Winston Churchill The Private War SPECIAL
The world will remember him as one of the most illustrious military, literary and political figures of our time. Yet he secretly fought an agonizing personal battle against depression and self -doubt. Narrated by Hal Holbrook, this documentary uses rare film footage and still photographs to create a moving account of one of the great figures in history.		 1981:

Gene Hackman stars as a basketball coach, plagued by a scandal in hsi past, who moves to a small Indiana town—and guides the underdog high school team to a state championship. This is an informative program on how you can attempt to prevent drug and alcohol abuse by your children. It's a no-nonsense, straight half-hour of practical advice in the style of the award-winning How to Raise a Street-Smart Child. How to Raise a Street-Smart Child :45 Hosted by Daniel J. Travanti
A PROGRAM NO PARENT CAN AFFORD TO MISS
Does your child know...
...exactly who is a "stranger"?
...how to say "no" to adults?
...how to dial "911" for help?
How can you help your child protect himself against the possibility of sexual abuse, kidnapping and assault? This timely program has some surprising answers. With the help of law enforcement and child abuse experts, host Daniel J. Travanti outlines simple rules that you may never have thought of. Due to the subject matter, very young children should watch with a parent.		 1987:

Cindy Williams, Ron Howard and Candy Clark head the cast of this pleasing sequel. Although not a box office match for the first blockbuster, The N.Y. Post said: New Graffiti tops the original. 1980:
Sep 26,​30

He finds the Big Apple a magic place, but not without its share of worms. Directed by Paul Mazursky (An Unmarried Woman). 1985:

Neil Simon's Chapter Two (PG) 2:06 Adult siutations and language. James Caan Marsha Mason
The joys of life after 30 and love after separation are at the heart of this warm, amusing drama. Adapted by Neil Simon from his autobiographical Broadway success, the film stars Jams Can as a newly widowed novelist adjusting in a second marriage to newly divorced Marsha Mason (an Oscar-nominee performance). Valerie Harper and Joseph Bologna are involved in a comic subplot. Tender, compassionate and gently humorous all at once (Variety)		 1981:

Not Necessarily the News January Edition (1983) Series Premiere HBOnly! Don't let the title fool you. You've never seen a “news” show like this. HBO's first original comedy series uncovers the laugh angle behind the headlines. Leaders and losers, celebrities and fads get parodied in a half hour of topical send-ups and put-downs.

Not Necessarily the Year in Review (1988) The past year was a good one, wasn't it? That is, unless you were involved in Iranscam, or your name is Gary Hart, or you put your savings in the stock market! In their latest HBO special, the NNTN news team—and guests Edwin Newman and George Wendt—reexamine the high (?) points of 1987. Approx 1:00. 1988:

NEW LAUGHS! EVERY WEEK!

Norma Rae (PG) 1:54 Profanity, adult situations. Academy Award Winner Sally Field as Norma Rae
Her portrayal of a spunky Southern mill worker, finding strength within herself to lead a union fight, won Sally Field this year’s Oscar. She captures all the anger and pathos of a modern woman torn between tradition and horror of the mill. Beau Bridges is her well-meaning husband and Ron Leibman, the Northerner leading her to new awareness. The film also won the Oscar for best original song.		 1980:

This classic of mistaken identity and espionage is one of Hitchcock's best. Cary Grant is a businessman caught in a web of intrigue from New York to the famous climax atop Mt. Rushmore. Eva Marie Saint, James Mason co-star.		 1981:

North Dallas Forty (R) 1:58 Profanity, adult situations, nudity. Nick Nolte
Mac Davis
Football is the backdrop for this brutally honest, adult comedy of one mans rebellion against the sport and the system. Nick Note, a wide receiver starting to decline, is the man forced to make moral choices in an immoral world. Singer Mac Davis is impressive as his pal, a roguish quarterback with a salty tongue. Plenty of grid-iron action. Fresh, funny and powerful (Newsweek)		 1980:

Not-So-Great Moments in Sports Take III HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
Thrilling, heart-stopping moments of greatness and glory? Forget itl Here's the flip side of sports history. lighthearted and irreverent tales of the famous and obscure. It's al here, from Battling Siki, who agreed to throw a title fight then changed his mind, to Bill Buckner's disastrous goof in the '86 World Series. Famous and rare film footage and interviews tell the stories a lot of athletes would just rather forget!		 1989:

Candice Bergen
Oliver Barrett IV tries to pick up the pieces of a broken life after the death of his wife in this touching sequel to Love Story. Candice Bergen, a beautiful, independent-minded heiress, forces Ryan O’Neal, who plays Oliver, to come to grips with himself. Nicola Pagett and Ray Milland co-star. On Location: David Brenner Tune in for another laugh-filled look into the life of this popular comedian. In his third exclusive Home Box Office special, Brenner spills out more true stories as he reminisces about his growing up years in Philadelphia and his college days at Temple University. On Location:® Don Rickles and His Wise Guys The master of insult comedy and ad-lib makes his long awaited Home Box Office debut. He’s lined up a host of very funny wise guys including: Wayland Flowers and Madame; Bruce Baum, a wild zany who uses props and costumes; Jackie Wakefield, renowned “Catskill” funnyman; Pudgy, a spicy comedienne (often called the female Rickles) and Johnny Yune, the Korean comic. It’s an evening of frantic fun with rapier-wit Rickles in charge. 1980:

On Location: George Carlin Again! This one's a wow of a show! Humorist/comedian George Carlin, whose 1977 On Location won a National Cable Television Association award, is back by popular demand on HBO—with brand new material in a brand new show! Sights, sounds, faces, dialects—nothing escapes his comic outlook. A satirist and word-smith, Carlin's now famous Seven-words-you-don't-say-on-TV routine (which you'll hear again!) has made him a comic favorite. Keenly perceptive, unique, significant—are all words that apply to George. Most important, he's a very funny man! 1980:
Jan 1		 1

On Location: King Goes to Queens Catch New Yorker Alan King at Queens College with his special brand of unrestrained humor. He uses his tongue like a pitchfork to skewer the everyday things that nag us all. Critic Kenneth Tynan said: "If a sawed-off shotgun could talk, it would sound like Alan King." 1980:

On Location: Martin Mull You may remember him as both Barth and Garth Gimble on Fernwood 2-Night and America 2-Night, Now catch the multi-talented Martin Mull On Location in his first all-out TV special. (And we promise, you'l never forget him.) He lets go with a highly entertaining and sophisticated hour of hilarity. He woos you with his wonderful comic songs; he wins you with his words. Martin Mull is both irresistible and irreverent —and considers himself today’s Victor Borge. Don't miss this one! 1980:
Jan 1		 1

Paper Moon (PG) 1:42 Profanity, adult situations. Ryan O'Neal Tatum O'Neal
An American classic and a box office smash. The O’Neals are small-time swindlers selling bibles in the Bible Belt during the Depression, always just one step ahead of the law. Nine-year-old Tatum smokes, swears, steals—a brilliant send-up of Shirley Temple coyness. Fading carny dancer Madeline Kahn is a wonderfully funny co-star. (B/W)		 1980:
Jul 30
Aug 3,​7,​11		 4

Frequently violent, the film is a moving commentary on man’s inhumanity to man. 1982:

WILLEN DAFOE

This searing, powerful drama of American soldiers in Vietnam was nominated for eight 1986 Oscars® and won four, including Best Picture and Best Director (Oliver Stone). Charlie Sheen (Wall Street) plays a young, idealistic recruit who wants to rest himself on the battlefield—and gets much more than he bargained for. Brilliantly acted (New York magazine). Private Benjamin (R) 1:50 Adult situations, humor, profanity, brief nudity. Goldie Hawn
The Army was never like this—and there was never а raw recruit like Judy Benjamin! In a laugh-a-minute spoof of life, love and very adult relationships, Goldie Hawn virtually destroys basic training with a splendid Oscar-nominated performance. Eileen Brennan (also an Oscar nominee) lends strong support in a tale about a woman coming into her own.		 1981:

Red King, White Knight 1:44 AS, AL, V TOM SKERRIT MAX VON SYDOW
THE HBO ORIGINAL MOVIE FOR NOVEMBER
The only thing standing between the Soviet Premier and an assassin's bullet is an American agent. When the CIA learns of a rogue KGB operative's plot to kill the Soviet leader, former CIA agent Stoner (Tom Skerritt) returns to duty to intercept and neutralize the assassin. Max Von Sydow costars as a Soviet counterintelligence agent assigned to kill Stoner in this engrossing tale of high-level espionage. With Helen Mirren (The Mosquito Coast).
A Russian Conspiracy, an American hero.		 1989:

HBO's Remember When "Way Out West" SERIES PREMIERE
The Story of the American Cowboy. Remember when cowboys roamed the frontier of the Old West? Life in that fabled era is the subject of the first in HBO’s exclusive eight-part sequel to the award-winning Time Was series. Host Dick Cavett reviews the facts and fiction surrounding the great American legacy—the cowboys and outlaws; the frontier cities, saloons and women; the rodeos and western movies.		 1981:
May 11,​14,​17,​23,​27,​29
1984:
Sep 1,​4,​7
1985:
Nov 3,​6,​7,​11,​15,​20,​26
1989:
Oct 9,​13,​17		 21
HBO's Remember When "On the Air" SPECIAL
The Story of Radio in America
Dick Cavett hosts this exciting history of radio from Marconi to the end of big-time radio. Using newsreels, on-location footage and movie clips, Cavett highlights: Bing Crosby; Jack Dempsey’s historic title bout; FDR’s fireside chats; radio bloopers; Major Bowes Amateur Hour; the big bands; the mystery shows and much more. It was the magic of the airwaves, and it was wonderful.		 1981:
Jun 8,​11,​14,​17,​19,​24
1984:
Sep 8,​11,​12,​14
1985:
Dec 7,​12,​17,​23,​26		 16
HBO's Remember When "Wheels, Wings and Whistles" SPECIAL
The Story of Transportation in America.
The paddle-wheel steamships, the Wright brothers at Kitty Hawk, the golden railroad spikes, the first man on the moon—it’s the story of a nation in motion from landing at Plymouth Rock to exploring outer space. Dick Cavett recalls it all in the third episode of HBO’s exclusive eight-part series about our history and our national identity.		 1981:
Jul 6,​10,​11,​14,​18,​23,​26
1984:
Sep 15,​18,​21
1986:
Jan 3,​4,​6,​14,​15
1989:
Nov 3,​14,​29		 18
HBO's Remember When "It'll Never Fly" The Story of American Inventors
Dick Cavett hosts HBO's exclusive series exploring our national identity. The story of inventors who changed the face of America and inventions that revolutionized our life as well as the gizmos that failed to find any practical use (an automatic hat tipper?). Featured are Thomas Edison, the Wright brothers and other giants.		 1981:
Aug 3,​6,​9,​14,​17,​22
1984:
Sep 22,​25,​28
1986:
Feb 1,​4,​5,​10,​13

May 9,​10,​19		 19

Host Dick Cavett introduces you to the giants of journalism: Ben Franklin, William Randolph Hearst, Joseph Pulitzer and Henry Luce. Other features: yellow journalism, newsreels and comic strips. 1981:

Other highlights: Alexander Cartwright (father of baseball); football's Knute Rockne; boxer “Gentleman Jim” Corbett; women in sports; great triumphs and great goofs.		 1981:

Sky Spectacular SPORTS SPECIAL
High-flying entertainment as the sky is turned into a giant sports arena during this novel and fascinating air show. Almost 11,500 aircraft from 50 different countries will be on hand for the Oshkosh Air Show, the largest sports-aviation event in the world. Aerial acrobatics, formation flying, wing walking, aerial clowning and daredevil stunts will make you laugh, gasp and keep you on the edge of your seat. On top of all that, there's a look at planes of the future and vintage film of aviation’s glorious past.		 1980:

HBO Sneak Preview Jerry Stiller and Anne Meara, the country’s number one comedy couple, tell you what to expect on HBO in an entertaining combination of comic sketches and highlights from upcoming specials, sports and movies.

Jerry Stiller and Anne Meara were the hosts of HBO Sneak Preview until December of 1981. Leonard Harris became the new host in January of '82. The show ended with the Sneak Peak of September '82, which was replaced with HBO Magazine, hosted by Dick Cavett. -JS		 1980:

So You Wanna Be A Star? SPECIAL
What does it take to get to the top? This exclusive HBO documentary shows you the true story of five aspiring young performers and their determination to “make it” in the world of entertainment. Valerie Lee, a dancer-singer-acress trying to succeed on Broadway; Larry Miller, a young comedian; Charly McClain, a country western singer; Zora Rasmussen, a nightclub performer, and Rocky Bauer, a young actor. Sports Around The World: Australian Surf Lifesaving Australian Surf Lifesaving.
It began as a way to save lives and is now one of the biggest athletic events in the world. HBO jets to Australia, where 5,000 sturdy competitors challenge thunderous waves as they sprint, row, kayak, surf and swim. Five-man crews race 25-foot whaleboats out to sea and back in the most exciting team event. The most grueling individual matchup isThe Iron Man grind, a combination of rowing, distance swimming and sprinting.		 1980:
Aug 18,​20,​22,​26		 4

Casey Stengel and George Steinbrenner added to the glory. Highlighting this special will be a revealing look at some living legends such as Yogi Berra, Whitey Ford, Phil Rizzuto and Mickey Mantle. 1981:

Tailspin: Behind the Korean Airliner Tragedy 1:30 AN HBO ORIGINAL MOVIE
MICHAEL MURPHY
HARRIS YULIN
MICHAEL MORIARTY
CHRIS SARANDON
TERRIFYING. TOP SECRET. TRUE. THE INSIDE STORY TWO GOVERNMENTS WERE AFRAID TO TELL.
In August 1983, Korean Airlines Flight 007 was shot down over Soviet airspace. Everyone aboard — 269 innocent people — was killed. Did the Soviet military make a tragic error, or was it a deliberate, brutal attack? Extensively researched, this chillingly real HBO Original Movie takes us inside Washington's corridors of power to probe the extraordinary truth behind the most serious threat to world peace since the 1962 Cuban missle crisis.		 1989:
Aug 20,​23,​26,​27,​29
Sep 1,​6,​12		 11

Lorenzo Lamas stars as an athlete under the strain of family problems. Edward Hermann plays a comical English teacher who coaches the mat team while dreaming of a big job at Harvard. Stephen First (Animal House) is a tuba-playing heavy-weight. 1980:

Art Carney
Barbara Hershey

The Last Emperor (PG-13) 2:46 AL, V, BN 1987 OSCAR® WINNER BEST PICTURE
JOHN LONE
PETER O'TOOLE
JOAN CHEN
“Mesmerizing” says Newsweek about this winner of nine 1987 Oscars®, including Best Picture and Best Director (Bernardo Bertolucci). This dazzling saga tells the stor of Pu Yi, the 3-year-olbdoy who became emperor of China in 1908. Living in the spectacular Forbidden City, Pu Yi grew up in sumptuous surroundings accompanied by royal treatment. Later deposed, the last emperor became a western-style playboy and then Japan's puppet emperor of Manchuria until the end of World War I! John Lone plays Pu Yi in his adult years. Peter O'Toole plays Reginald Johnson, his British tutor.
1989:
Feb 12,​15,​18,​21,​24,​26		 7

Thrill Sports! Speed skiing. Cliff jumping. Hang gliding. Sound risky? Not to these super-skilled sportsmen. At the 1980 World Speed Skiing Championships they’ll attempt to break the unpowered land-speed record of 124 mph at Storm Peak, Colo. Then on to Hawaii for hang gliding in the world’s toughest wind. Back in Canyon del Muerto, Ariz., jumpers free-fall from 1,000-foot cliffs. What makes them do it? Watch Thrill Sports—and learn why. 1980:

Time Was... The Seventies The final segment of HBO’s exclusive series delving into the decades past. This one zeroes in on a nation disillusioned, divided and in shock. Watergate. The resignation of a president. Vietnam. Patty Hearst, the rise of cults. Positive action toward peace in the Middle East. Time Was... The Sixties One more piece from the picture of the past in this exclusive HBO series hosted by Dick Cavett. From the “Camelot” days of JFK to the conservatism of Nixon when policies at home were attacked and unrest was nationwide. The decade when an articulate, disillusioned and challenging young generation surfaced. Vietnam. The Bay of Pigs. Assassinations. Riots. The Beatles. Woodstock. The Twist. Women’s lib. Tom Horn (R) 1:38 Adult situations, profanity, graphic violence. Steve McQueen
A real hero of the Old West, one of the last frontiersmen, Tom Horn is a cool loner, a man of action and few words. Steve McQueen plays the legendary bounty hunter as he nears the end of his trail. Wandering into Wyoming in 1901, he is hired to clean out cattle rustlers —a job he may perform too well. In possibly his most underrated role, McQueen creates a giant of the disappearing frontier.		 1981:

Tootsie (PG) 1:56 Adult situations, language. Dustin Hoffman Jessica Lange Teri Garr - Dressed as a woman to audition for a TV soap opera, a desperate New York actor finds himself leading a frantic double life. This is the premise for one of the most popular comedies in Hollywood history, a smash with both the public and the critics. Dustin Hoffman plays the edgy, cantankerous Michael Dorsey, who transforms himself into poised, self-assured Dorothy Michaels. Jessica Lange won an Oscar as the soap star who confides in her matronly new colleague. With Bill Murray (Stripes) and Dabney Coleman (WarGames). Nominated for ten Oscars, including Best Picture. 1984:
May 3,​13,​16,​19,​22,​23,​25,​28,​29

Oct 28
1985:
May 6,​7,​15,​25,​31		 25

VAL KILMER
Danger, fantasy and romance add up to adventure in this epic directed by Ron Howard Cocoon. Willow is a little person, a simple farmer and would-be sorcerer who finds a baby girl in a basket on the river. Wimbledon! (1980) From the action at center court to the Royal Box and bowls of cream-drenched strawberries, Wimbledon is tennis’ most prestigious event. Catch every important serve, slam and volley as HBO brings you same-day highlights of the best early-round matches. Bjorn Borg, aiming for an unprecedented five straight titles, must hold off John McEnroe and Jimmy Conners. Martina Navratilova, trying for her third straight, will battle Tracy Austin and maybe Chris Evert Lloyd. 1980:
Jun 23,​24,​25,​26,​27,​28
Jul 1,​2,​3,​4		 14
Wimbledon '81 SPORTS SPECIAL
The world’s finest players gather each year for the sport’s most coveted prize. Jimmy Connors aptly calls it the Olympics of tennis. See the best at their best from Bjorn Borg and John McEnroe to Chris Evert Lloyd and Tracy Austin. Arthur Ashe will be there for HBO to bring you same-day highlights of early-round matches, and the women’s quarterfinals on June 30th. Continues into July!		 1981:
Jun 22,​23,​24,​25,​26,​30

World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Bramble vs. Mancini HBO SPORTS EVENT World Championship Boxing LIVE! Livingstone Bramble-“Boom-Boom” Mancini Rematch — Look for fireworks in this rematch of last June's championship. That battle cost Mancini his lightweight title in a stunning upset. Knocked out in the 14th round, he was beaten at his own pressure game Bramble’s sharp, inside attack never let up. Ever since, Mancini's been waiting for a rematch. This fight, scheduled for 15 rounds, promises to be one of the best of the year. 1985:

World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Curry vs McCrory ★ LIVE! ★
HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING
DONALD CURRY vs. MILTON McCRORY
DECEMBER 6
WELTERWEIGHT UNIFICATION TITLE FIGHT
Tonight, two undefeated champions clash for the unified welterweight title. Not since Sugar Ray Leonard has one  man worn both welterweight crowns. And not since Sugar Ray have we seen a boxer the likes of Donald Curry, a superb technician in the ring. But the hard-hit-ting McCrory is no slouch. Packing a lethal left jab and a powerful right, he won his first 16 fights by KOs. Scheduled for 15 rounds, this fight should be a beauty. 		1985:
Dec 6		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Double Header Starling vs. Breland and Chavez vs. Aguilar HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
LIVE APRIL 16
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING DOUBLEHEADER
WBA WELTERWEIGHT TITLE FIGHT
WBA CHAMPION
MARLON STARLING
vs.
FORMER WBA CHAMPION
MARK BRELAND
Two terrific 12-rounders!Fighter of the Year Julio Cesar Chavez defends his WBA Lightweight crown against #1 contender Rodolfo Aguilar. Also, Mark Breland tries to regain the WBA Welterweight title from Marlon Starling. Breland was ahead on points last August when Starling nailed him. In tonight's rematch, his future and reputation are on the line.

JULIO CESAR CHAVEZ
vs.

World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Dwight Braxton vs. Matthew Saad Muhammad Tonight Saad Muhammad is out to regain theWBC light heavyweight title from champ Dwight Braxton—the man who shocked him in a startling upset last December. But Saad will first have to stop Braxton’s power-house right. Scheduled for 15 rounds, this revenge bout should be a battle. 1982:
Aug 7		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Dwight Braxton vs. Michael Spinks It's winner-take-all tonight as the undisputed World Light Heavyweight title is on the line—with two great Champions slugging it out in a scheduled 15 rounder. WBC titleholder Braxton (only 5’6” tall) will be constantly moving, crowding Spinks, with hard, crisp jabs. But undefeated WBA champ Spinks is a paralyzing puncher—his chief enforcer is the “Spinks Jinx,” a smashing overhand right. It’s a classic match-up of contrasting ring styles. 1983:
Mar 18		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Greg Page vs. Tim Witherspoon LIVE! HBOnly! LIVE! World Championship Boxing Greg Page vs. Tim Witherspoon - WBC Heavyweight Championship - Tonight the WBC heavyweight title is up for grabs as the two top contenders battle for the crown recently vacated by Larry Holmes. New names and faces will now fight for the spotlight. Greg Page has beaten the best in the division, losing only once in 24 bouts. He never got his chance at Holmes, but Tim Witherspoon did, losing a controversial split decision. It should be a battle when these evenly matched, young punchers lock horns for 12 rounds. LIVE! HBOnly! LIVE! 1984:
Mar 9		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Hagler vs. Hamsho OCTOBER 19 LIVE! World Championship Boxing WBA/WBC Middleweight Title Fight World Middleweight Champion Marvelous Marvin Hagler vs. Mustafa Hamsho #1-Ranked Contender plus Junior middleweights Mike McCallum and Sean Mannion battle for Roberto Duran's vacated WBA Title. 1984:
Oct 19		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Hagler vs. Hearns Tonight WBA/WBC champion Hagler and ex-welter-weight champ Hearns meet head-on for the world middleweight crown. Marvelous Marvin Hagler (52-2-2, 45 KOs), who hasn't lost a bout in over six years, faces his toughest challenge to date in Thomas Hearns (34-1, 31 KOs)—who has already won twice in his new division. HBO is the only national pay TV service showing this event. (Will not be seen live in the Detroit area.)

Note: This fight never happened. After the guide was printed, it was changed to a fight between Hagler and Fulgencio Obelmejias, but then that was cancelled due to an injury from Hagler. Still investigating what aired during this time. -JS		 1982:
Jul 15		 1

Oct 30		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Hector "Macho" Camacho vs. Edwin Rosario HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING
HECTOR "MACHO" CAMACHO
vs.
EDWIN ROSARIO
WBC LIGHTWEIGHT TITLE FIGHT
The dazzling "Macho Man" defends his WBC Lightweight title against ex-champ Edwin Rosario. The unbeaten Camacho (29-0) faces a talented boxer in Rosario, who's only lost once in 24 matches. This scheduled 12-rounder promises brilliant boxing.
LIVE! JUNE 13		 1986:
Jun 13		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Holmes vs. Bey Only on HBO! LIVE! March 15 — Heavyweight Title Fight — Tonight we could see history in the making as Larry Holmes defends his IBF heavy-weight crown against a hungry challenger, David Bey. Bey (14-0) won this shot at Holmes with his solid upset of Greg Page. In his last fight, the aging champ had a tough time stopping James “Bonecrusher” Smith. Can the proud, undefeated Holmes preserve his perfect record? 1985:
Mar 15		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Holmes vs. Cooney — The Pride and the Glory 1:30 HBO Sports WBC Heavyweight Championship Larry Holmes vs. Gerry Cooney

This was a last minute edition to the schedule and does not appear in the HBO Guide for June of 1982. It replaced an airing of "High Risk" on the 18th and "Silver Streak" on the 20th. -JS		 1982:
Jun 18,​20		 2
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Holmes vs. Smith World Championship Boxing
LIVE! ★ November 9
Exclusive - Larry Holmes vs. James “Bonecrusher” Smith It's youth versus experience in this scheduled 15-rounder. Undefeated heavyweight champ Larry Holmes returns to the ring to defend his International Boxing Federation title against James ‘Bonecrusher"' Smith. Holmes, with 45 wins, wants to make the record books by passing Rocky Marciano's record of 49-0. His opponent, with a record of 14 wins and only one loss, knocked out Frank Bruno last time out. 		1984:
Nov 9		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Holmes vs. Spinks HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
LARRY HOLMES
★ VS. ★
MICHAEL SPINKS
LIVE!
SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 21
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING
IFB HEAVYWEIGHT TITLE FIGHT
Will Larry Holmes equal Rocky Marciano’s record of 49-0? Or will Michael Spinks be the first light heavyweight champ in history to capture the heavy-weight crown? Although Holmes has a big edge in size and reach, Spinks is a cagey boxer with a paralyzing right. See these two greats clash in this scheduled 15-rounder and also catch some exciting preliminary bouts.		 1985:
Sep 21		 1
World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Iron Mike Tyson vs. Carl "The Truth" Williams HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
LIVE! JULY 21
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING
HEAVYWEIGHT TITLE FIGHT
IRON MIKE TYSON
UNDISPUTED HEAVYWEIGHT CHAMPION
vs.
CARL The Truth WILLIAMS
IBF #1-RANKED CONTENDER
Undefeated WBA/WBC/IBF heavyweight champ Tyson faces IBF #1-ranked contender Williams in defense of his unified title. These two are former sparring partners, and Williams fels he can beat Tyson with a hard jab, mobility and a lot of thinking. But I can't be beaten, says Tyson, who last time out crushed Frank Bruno in five. If this one goes the scheduled 12 founds, Williams just might have a chance!		 1989:

FORMER WBC MIDDLEWEIGHT CHAMPION
Tonight, undefeated Michael Nunn defends his IBF middle-weight crown for the third time as he faces rugged Iran Barkley. Nunn impresively knocked out his last two oponents. But the quick, slippery southpaw must avoid Barkley’s devastating right hand. It’s a dynamite match-up as the boxer meets the bruiser in this scheduled 12-rounder.

World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Michael Spinks vs. Eddie Mustafa Muhammad Tonight the title is on the line for champion Michael Spinks. Spinks has won every fight in the last 5 years for two solid reasons—a strong left jab and a powerful overhand right (the ‘Spinks jinx’). But Mustafa Muhammad, the No. 1 contender, will be out to win back the title that Spinks took from him two years ago. 1983:

WORLD HEAVYWEIGHT SERIES

VS. WBA CHAMPION

Live!
This WBA/WBC heavyweight unification bout matches undefeated sensation Mike Tyson against James "Bonecrusher" Smith. Last November Tyson became the youngest heavyweight champ in history. Tonight's victor next meets Michael Spinks for the undisputed championship of the world!

World Championship Boxing (LIVE) Mike Tyson vs. Larry Holmes HBO SPORTS EXCLUSIVE
WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING
UNIFIED HEAVYWEIGHT TITLE FIGHT
UNIFIED CHAMPION
MIKE TYSON
vs.
Larry Holmes
LIVE!
JANUARY 22
Tonight, Mike Tyson gives Larry Holmes a crack at his unified WBA/WBC/IBF heavyweight crown. This is Tyson's second title defense. Last October he stopped Tyrell Biggs with a crushing seventh-round KO. But if anyone can out-box him, it's Holmes. For years he dominated the division, losing only twice t Mchael Spinks—and many felt Holmes won the last controversial decision. Now the embittered veteran comes out of retirement fighting for his pride and his reputation.		 1988:

World Championship Boxing (Live) Pinklon Thomas vs. Trevor Berbick HBO SPORTS PRESENTS WORLD CHAMPIONSHIP BOXING
WBC
HEAVYWEIGHT
TITLE FIGHT
LIVE! MARCH 22
WBC Champion Pinklon Thomas vs. Top Ranked Contender Trevor Berbick
WBC heavyweight champion Pinklon Thomas wields the kind of punishing left jab that experts say is the best since Sonny Liston's. Get a ringside look at it as he tangles with USBA champ and top-ranked WBC contender Trevor Berbick. Thomas, a stand-up boxer with amazingly quick reflexes wants to see a unified heavy-weight title, and this scheduled 12-rounder is the first step toward that goal. Larry Merchant, Barry Tompkins and Sugar Ray Leonard call the action.		 1986:

Dec 10		 1
World Championship Boxing (Live) Weaver vs. Tillis and Hagler vs. Hamsho Two world titles are on the line tonight in this exclusive doubleheader. Each of these live bouts is scheduled for 15 rounds. Mike Weaver (23-9, 16 KOs) defends his WBA heavyweight crown against unbeaten James Tillis (21-0, 16 KOs). Another pair of punchers meet for the combined WBA-WBC middle-weight titles. In that one, Marvin Hagler (52-2-2, 43 KOs), holder of both titles, faces rugged Mustata Hamsho (32-1-1, 19 KOs). Barry Tompkins and Larry Merchant report.

HBOnly!		 1982:
Feb 15		 1
World Championship Boxing: Sugar Ray Leonard vs. Thomas Hearns 1:29 I believe this is a replay of the fight from Sept. 16, 1981 at Caesars Palace. What's odd is that according to the guides, this hadn't aired on HBO before. There was a special hyping the then upcoming match called, "Countdown to the Showdown Leonard-Hearns" that aired in Sept. of '81, but this is the first record of the actual match airing on HBO. -JS 1989:

World Pro Skiing The world Pro Skiing tour revolutionized the sport with dual slalom events in which racers zip over courses side by side. For the third straight season, HBO presents exclusive coverage of the Avis Cup met from Stowe, Vermont. The competition features the world’s best skiers, including Australian sensation André Arnold and two dazzling Americans—Lonny Vanatta and Richie Woodworth. 1981:

World Series Scouting Report (1981) As vital as statistics are to baseball fans, they are often not enough. That's why this 60-minute special on the October classic bats 1,000. You'll learn the strengths, weaknesses and idiosyncrasies of both World Series teams—from benches to bull pens, from hitters to fielders, from starting pitchers to specialists. If you really want to find out more than the statistics, watch Tim McCarver, Barry Tompkins and their expert guests. Plus highlights of the greatest moments from past World Series. 1981:

Barbra Streisand Mandy Patinkin Amy Irving — A girl with a dream sets off a chain of romantic complications when she disguises herself as a man in order to study at an all-male Yeshiva school.
